security: This document contains information from a confidential informant regarding communications between Carlos Alejos, Miguel Ydigoras-Fuentes, and Jose Miro Cardona related to anti-Fidel Castro activities. Disclosing this information could expose the informant, compromise intelligence-gathering methods, and negatively impact diplomatic relations with Guatemala and Cuba. It is labeled CONFIDENTIAL with a distribution restriction.
summary: An FBI report details a confidential informant's information about Carlos Alejos, Guatemalan Ambassador to the United States, facilitating communication between Miguel Ydigoras-Fuentes and Jose Miro Cardona concerning anti-Fidel Castro activities.
summary_one_paragraph: On February 21, 1963, an FBI report relayed information from a confidential source stating that Carlos Alejos, the Guatemalan Ambassador to the U.S., contacted Miguel Ydigoras-Fuentes about Jose Miro Cardona, President of the Cuban Revolutionary Council, expressing regret for missing a meeting and praising Ydigoras-Fuentes' actions regarding Cuba; Ydigoras-Fuentes agreed to meet Cardona in Guatemala and instructed Alejos to issue him a visa, highlighting the ongoing anti-Fidel Castro activities involving these individuals.
title: ANTI-FIDEL CASTRO ACTIVITIES
